author: m.kalinin
content: Great work! I haven't checked it for missed opcodes yet. A couple of things. Block number will probably stay inside of Eth1 block, likewise timestamp. Regarding `COINBASE` it would probably make sense to pass proposer's address to eth1-engine, so it could be included into a block as coinbase. Because coinbase will likely be used to pay transaction fees on Eth1 Shard.

author: gballet
content: Coinbase and friends are currently part of the eth1 engine configuration. Likewise, no need to pass the list of blockhashes by rpc, the engine is aware of them.

author: gballet
content: One thought regarding the difficulty: if it is indeed used as a rng seed, then maybe it should be _random_ (based on some consensus variable) in order to make sure that this stuff doesn't break
